This invisible object is visible by default for easy placement in the toolset.

After placing the invisible wall, set the Initial State to "Deactivated" on the Advanced tab to make it not appear in the game.

This invisible object is visible by default for easy placement in the toolset.

After placing the invisible wall, set the Initial State to "Deactivated" on the Advanced tab to make it not appear in the game.

This script will spawn a chest at a randomly-selected waypoint within the area that this trigger is placed. It pulls all information from the variables set on the "lj_randchestspwn" trigger.

The Tag and the Resref of the chest-to-spawn must match in order to make sure duplicates don't appear. By default, the script uses the placeable chest lj_randchestspwn, but any chest can be used by setting the "resref" variable.

Place waypoints in your area tagged with the "resref" variable on this trigger. By default, this Resref is lj_randchestspwn and is on the palette in Waypoints > Special > Custom 4 > Randomized Chest Spawn Location. You do not need to place these waypoints within your trigger. I've also fixed the orientation so that it spawns according to the direction that the waypoint is facing.


Variables on the Trigger
----------

string resref: The tag/resref of the chest to spawn and tag of waypoints. Default is lj_randchestspwn

int BlockTime: The cooldown from this trigger spawning a new chest in seconds. Default is 1 hour (3600 seconds)

int OncePerReset: Setting 1 one will mean this fires 1/reset per player. Default is 0

int SearchDC: If set, this will require a search check to find chests. Default is 0

int LockedDC: If set, this will lock the chest and set an unlock DC. Default is 0

int ChestAppearance: You may set this to customize the appearance of your chest by referencing the index number in Placeables.2da. Default is 0 for the most basic-looking chest.

string ChestName: If set, customize the name of the spawned chest. Default is "Chest"

string ChestDescription: If set, customize the description of the spawned chest. Default is "This heavy chest may have been used for storing valuables."

----------
If using a custom chest, you do not need the following variables. If using the default, these will enable you to set amount of loot and quality of loot:

int RandomLoot: defines the upper integer of how much random loot you want to spawn (i.e., putting in 3 would spawn 0-3 random loot pieces). Default is 1

int FixedLoot: defines how much loot you always want spawned. This can be combined with RandomLoot. Default is 1

int LootLevel: defines which level of loot bin to be used. 1 is uber low, 3 is medium, 5 is uber, etc. Required - the chest will not work if LootLevel is not set from 1 to 5. Default is 1

float TimeLimit: defines how long it takes for the next batch of loot to spawn within the chest. This is in SECONDS (i.e. 60.0 = one minute ). If this is not set, it will default to the BlockTime. This is different from BlockTime in that you can have a chest spawn once, but have its contents refresh multiple times before it is destroyed. Default is 0 (and thus reverts to BlockTime)

This is the default waypoint you may place to set a patrol path for a creature or NPC.
1. Create the creature and either use its current Tag or fill in a new one.
2. Place or make sure the WalkWayPoints() is within the body of the On Spawn script for the creature.
3. Place a series of waypoints along the route you wish the creature to walk.
4. Select all of the newly created waypoints and right click. Choose the Create Set option.
5. The waypoint set will have a set name of "WP_" + NPC Tag. Thus if an NPC with the Tag "Guard" will have a waypoint set called "WP_Guard". Note that Tags are case sensitive.

This waypoint is meant to be used with the Randomized Chest Spawn trigger in Triggers > Special > Custom 4.

This waypoint will be a variable location for the default loot chest, which the trigger script will pick randomly.

Place this waypoint in an area as a target for the spawns scripts. You can place as many of them as you want. The spawn scripts pick up to 4 spawnpoints an area to spawn creatures on as long as there's one or more PCs in the area.
